channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: From @WSJopinion: The Supreme Court has a chance to send a message to judges on rewriting election law in the middle of the game https://t.co/BduPvsnBl8
Al Horford had played more playoff games than anyone in NBA history without making the finals. On Thursday, he helped the Celtics take a 1-0 lead over Golden State. https://t.co/FGs6XrtQ3O
Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine plans to sign a bill reducing training requirements for teachers and other staff to carry guns in schools https://t.co/w80EyS28zF
Harini Logan, a 14-year-old from San Antonio, won the Scripps National Spelling Bee after correctly spelling 22 words as part of the competition’s first-ever spell-off https://t.co/9PNhTPYvpP
JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon said U.S. consumers still have some six to nine months of spending power in their bank accounts but warned of tumult ahead https://t.co/3pIlKrz6Oo

U.S. employers added 390,000 jobs in May, beating many economists’ expectations and extending a yearslong streak of strong gains in the labor market #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/wcYuNSy6sZ https://t.co/9rHaf7uals
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/WkagGa6QWK

Federal prosecutors have charged former Trump White House official Peter Navarro with contempt of Congress for defying a subpoena from the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021. attack on the U.S. Capitol https://t.co/tre6eAgmED
China nears launch of advanced aircraft carrier, satellite images show; ship will enable China to project military power globally, analysts say https://t.co/Pcu1cL1iJt

To help Ukraine export its wheat, Poland is scouring Europe for spare train wagons, encouraging truck companies to send drivers east and dispatching leaders to reassure far-off countries desperate for wheat https://t.co/Bi6dcEKiSb
The U.S. economy added 390,000 jobs in May, extending a yearlong streak of strong gains. The jobless rate remained at 3.6%. https://t.co/wxYWCDIuyD

Sheryl Sandberg’s departure from Meta coincides with a company investigation into her activities, including a review of her use of corporate resources to help plan her coming wedding https://t.co/RNy4ApmhEZ
President Biden says he “can’t take immediate action” to lower record-high gasoline prices https://t.co/jCG4KtPcAc

The Commodity Futures Trading Commission on Thursday sued the crypto company owned by the billionaire Winklevoss brothers, saying it misled regulators as part of an effort to gain approval for bitcoin futures in 2017 https://t.co/GwXlKnApeo

From @WSJopinion: Are we doomed to high inflation for years? No. Depending on the details of timing, inflation will fall as quickly and dramatically as it rose. We’ve seen it happen before, writes Alan Blinder https://t.co/86yK2IQevi
When ducklings line up behind their mother and paddle, they are employing sophisticated physics to reduce surface resistance. Looking cute is a side benefit. https://t.co/jrGFDHNmZj

After beating Scotland 3-1, Ukraine is now one victory from a spot in the World Cup. But what normally would have prompted a city-wide celebration was met with eerie silence across Kyiv. https://t.co/wvQepHeOKr
A 16-year-old boy was arrested after he plotted to carry out a mass shooting and a bombing at a high school in Berkeley, Calif., authorities said https://t.co/klL5eIKpv0

American teenager Coco Gauff captivated tennis during her breakthrough run at Wimbledon at age 15. Now she’s made the French Open final at 18—and will face World No. 1 sensation Iga Swiatek. Sports columnist @jasongay previews the matchup. https://t.co/NHWcquxvMK
The White House is going to start paying its interns for the first time ever. Starting this fall, they will earn $750 a week over a 14-week program. https://t.co/GpJf7JMlRY

To help Ukraine export its wheat, Poland is scouring Europe for spare train wagons, encouraging truck companies to send drivers east and dispatching leaders to reassure far-off countries desperate for wheat https://t.co/IeqtuqJh7S
Ukrainian security services are hunting down citizens they view as abetting Russia in a region where some Ukrainians still side with Moscow despite the war https://t.co/meQUgTEuNS

“For God’s sake, how much more carnage are we willing to accept?” President Biden called on Congress to reinstate a ban on assault-style weapons, or—failing that—raise the minimum age to purchase such firearms to 21 https://t.co/8APUrzmIMn
Johnny Depp has been the face of Dior’s Sauvage cologne since 2015. After his victory in court this week, fans are snatching up the fragrance. https://t.co/tDo7q4cEDw

Sheryl Sandberg’s departure from Meta coincides with a company investigation into her activities, including a review of her use of corporate resources to help plan her coming wedding https://t.co/LRAGJr7AVu

President Biden called on Congress Thursday to reduce gun violence by reinstating an assault-weapons ban and raising the age to purchase firearms from 18 to 21, among other changes: “These are rational, common-sense measures.” https://t.co/9wvezdM5yu
Tesla and SpaceX employees are required to spend at least 40 hours a week in the office, Elon Musk said this week in emails to staff https://t.co/L3wfbXpFdL
A 16-year-old boy was arrested after he plotted to carry out a mass shooting and a bombing at a high school in Berkeley, Calif., authorities said https://t.co/L8b4iOCBP7

LeBron James is officially a billionaire. The NBA superstar has a net worth of $1.2 billion based on endorsements, business ventures, cash and investments, according to Forbes. He is the first active NBA player to reach the milestone. https://t.co/PoDlvjrL3A
More than two-thirds of Americans want to uphold Roe v. Wade and 57% say a woman should be able to get an abortion for any reason, a WSJ poll finds https://t.co/hFycxumafv
As Queen Elizabeth II marks 70 years on the throne for her platinum jubilee, take a look at past celebrations of the British monarchy—from the U.K. to Jamaica https://t.co/am0hYTGyES

Lawyer Michael Avenatti was sentenced to four years in prison for stealing $300,000 from adult-film actress Stormy Daniels, whom he represented in her battles with former President Donald Trump https://t.co/ipZOHUrVvm
Breaking: The Tulsa, Okla., shooter killed the doctor who performed his back surgery last month, police said. A second doctor, a receptionist and a patient were also killed. https://t.co/1pGB1gjpQx
Axiom Space and Collins Aerospace will compete for NASA space-suit work that could be valued at a total of $3.5 billion https://t.co/OP5pXMcfzD
More than two-thirds of Americans want to uphold Roe v. Wade, and most favor access to legal abortion for any reason, a WSJ-NORC poll finds https://t.co/MFRyGDoMfC
OPEC and its allies agreed to a bigger-than-expected oil-production increase of 648,000 barrels a day in July and August, delegates said https://t.co/S5T1yH1bGW

Actor Johnny Depp was awarded $10.4 million in his case against Amber Heard in Virginia, while the actor’s former wife will receive $2 million in compensatory damages #WSJWhatsNow breaks down the numbers https://t.co/4c7FMFsjov https://t.co/pscTVQOMrs

Saudi Arabia is considering pumping more oil than planned to offset a decline in Russian crude production, a move the kingdom would tie to greater security guarantees from the U.S. https://t.co/wr2gZlSOLH
Thousands of well-wishers gather in central London to mark Queen Elizabeth II’s 70 years on the throne https://t.co/ONUgz1XYZu
As Queen Elizabeth II marks 70 years on the throne for her platinum jubilee, take a look at past celebrations of the British monarchy—from the U.K. to Jamaica https://t.co/uhwGH0k9e8

Criminal hacking gangs in countries like Russia, China and Iran are increasingly overlapping with national spy agencies. “They’re not only just accepted, but they’re supported by the intelligence services,” a U.S. official says. https://t.co/Yh16yitLyh
JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon said U.S. consumers still have some six to nine months of spending power in their bank accounts but warned of tumult ahead https://t.co/P8sIhmfP5z
Tesla employees are required to spend at least 40 hours a week in the office, Elon Musk said this week in an email to staff https://t.co/yt8EXGMM2n

Denmark voted to deepen its military cooperation with the rest of Europe, as a majority of Danes on Wednesday approved scrapping a 30-year-old opt-out that kept the Scandinavian nation out of common European Union security and defense policies https://t.co/rwrrsHScw4
Pfizer has asked the FDA to authorize its Covid-19 vaccine in children 6 months to 5 years. The three-dose series could be available later this month. https://t.co/V5I8cI8mic
President Biden says he “can’t take immediate action” to lower record-high gasoline prices https://t.co/wh2R39YUJt
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said supplying his country with long-range weapons doesn’t increase the risk of it attacking Russian territory https://t.co/LhlvPBh1fP

“Buy now, pay later” companies such as Affirm, Afterpay and Klarna promised a credit revolution that would change the way people pay for things. Rising delinquencies and a slowing economy are clouding that outlook. https://t.co/60rDPBH1Yz

“He very purposely went to this location, went to a very specific floor and shot with very specific purpose.” Tulsa police said Wednesday night that the deadly mass shooting at a medical clinic did not appear to be a random act. https://t.co/N6DDNg76Ww
Admiral Linda Fagan was sworn in Wednesday as the 27th commandant of the U.S. Coast Guard, making her the first woman to lead the military branch https://t.co/TE2hjsfDZk
